title: Kim Kardashian gathers children together for family photo shoot as she remembers visit
text:
Advertisement

She has enjoyed a moving and spiritual visit to her ancestral homeland of Armenia these last few days.

And Kim Kardashian is ensuring she will never forget the special adventure.

The reality star, 38, organized a photo shoot at the historic Temple Of Garni with her daughters North, six, Chicago, 20 months, and sons Saint, three, and Psalm, five months, on Thursday.

Making memories: Kim Kardashian organized a photo shoot at the historic Temple Of Garni with her daughters North, Chicago, and sons Saint and Psalm in Armenia on Thursday

It was the last day of Kim's trip, so undoubtedly she was keen on taking a few photos to remember the occasion.

Kim held the newest addition to her family while posing alongside a majestic backdrop of mountains with her children on either side.

Chicago held her mother's hand, while her big brother Saint flashed a big grin.

North stood on Kim's left, clad in a black dress with an ornate silver necklace and matching metallic hair wreath.

One for the photo album: Kim tenderly held Psalm as she sat upon a ledge alongside her youngsters

Say cheese: Photographers captured the family's meaningful visit to the ancient site

Boys will be boys! Saint let out a huge laugh as he emerged from the ancient temple with his cousin Reign

Picturesque: The scenic background would certainly help make the photo a family favorite

In addition to Kim's children, her sister Kourtney was also present with her kids.

The sisters combined their families while posing beside the magnificent temple and rolling hills.

Meanwhile, cousins Reign and Saint were having the times of their lives exploring the ancient building.

Saint let out a big laugh as he emerged from the temple right alongside Reign.

Rallying the kids: Chicago crouched to the floor at one point during the shoot

Doting mom: Kim had Psalm in her arms as she sat on the steps with her little ones

The whole family! Kourtney and her kids, Penelope and Reign, joined the others for the shoot

At one point, Kim treated her children to some well-deserved ice cream.

No doubt North was delighted to take a break from all the photo snapping to indulge in a nice midday treat.

Kim had her eye on an ice cream sandwich, while North chose a cone.

Sundae fun day! North enjoyed a break from all the photo snapping with a yummy ice cream cone

That's her boy: Kim affectionately placed her hand on Saint's back

Family hour: The whole family gathered together along a pathway

It already has been quite the eventful trip as Kim and sister Kourtney Kardashian visited the President of Armenia, Armen Sarkissian, and his wife, Nouneh Sarkissian, for dinner at the Presidential palace on Wednesday.

Their visit comes a day after they lay flowers at the Memorial Complex in Yerevan to pay tribute to the victims of the 1915 genocide in which 1.5m people lost their lives.

Kim also sat for a meeting with Armenia's Prime minister Nikol Pashinyan, which was pictured and publicly shared.

That's her big sister! North adorably held hands with her smiling younger sister

Just the girls: Chicago played around under the watch of Penelope and North

Moving: It has been a meaningful trip for Kim, who was baptized in Armenia along with her children

She and Kourtney took Mason and Penelope to the Armenian Genocide Memorial Complex in Tsitsernakaberd, Yerevan on Tuesday.

The memorial, which was built in 1967 is made up of an 'eternal flame' which is dedicated to those who lost their lives.

There are also twelve slabs, which are positioned in a circle and they represent the twelve lost provinces in Turkey.

Family first: Mason was also in attendance, though he did not appear to join them for the main photo shoot

Smile! North looked happy to be learning more about her heritage while Chicago played with her WubbaNub

The Armenian ancestors are on the Kardashians' father's side - his family emigrated to the United States from an area that now lies in Turkey.

Turkey denies the killing of up to 1.5 million Armenians, in what is now Turkey, in 1915 at the height of World War One constitutes genocide and relations with Armenia are still blighted by the dispute.

She first visited the site on April 24, 2015, the 100th anniversary of the deaths, where she lay red roses.

In addition to visiting the significant sites, Kim, Chicago, Saint, and Psalm were all baptized.

Yum! Saint was also treated to a delicious ice cream cone along with his sister
description: The reality star, 38, organized a photo shoot at the historic Temple Of Garni with her daughters North, Chicago, and sons Saint and Psalm on Thursday. It was the last day of Kim's trip.
